title: Computer-Assisted Language Learning (CALI) Software Development: Discovery Learning-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Project-based course where pre-service teachers plan and develop CALI software applying discovery learning principles. Teams collaborate in BYOD environments to create prototypes applicable to real educational settings

learning_goals: Learners can describe at least five stages of the CALI software development process incorporating discovery learning strategies.
Learners can design and validate at least three CALI grammar/vocabulary contents that minimize educational flaws.
Teams can develop a cross-platform compatible CALI software prototype and conduct usability testing
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
